channel.title: Why is my server still offline!? when I run it!? someone help!

item.title: Why is my server still offline!? when I run it!? someone help!
item.dc:creator: @tb1 tb
item.description:
@tb1 wrote:

lol no point in covering it up if you gonna say… " its in the place where my ‘.5’ is at", then have all the other numbers showing. xD

Read full topic
item.source: Why is my server still offline!? when I run it!? someone help!

item.title: Why is my server still offline!? when I run it!? someone help!
item.dc:creator: @Shorty626 Shorty626
item.description:
@Shorty626 wrote:

[quote=“wrath0fgufix, post:3, topic:326174”]It is because of one of these: your not running it right (you didn’t chasnge the ip to your own)

you did not portforward correctly

Uhm if you need to know how to portforward here is a guide I made.

Hello, i am showing how to portforward on your router.

First you’ll need to find your gateway ip address. Open your start menu and push the tab “run”

Then a small box will pop up–type in “Cmd” like the following

Then a new box will pop up that looks like this:

From here you will type in “ipconfig”

Then it will pop up a different things, you’ll want to find a “default gateway”
Next you will open your internet, and as your url you will type the “default gateway in the url.” Something sorta like this will be shown:

3590qya.jpg383×800

Then you will find something like virtual servers, it will ask you for a password leave it blank or use “admin”
It will then bring you to a different page that will look somewhat like this (matters what router you have)

It should be on the blank part where my “.5” it will be your ip address not your default gateway: look in your cmd for it

It should look like that or maybe w/o UDP
Then you can either use no-ip.org or www.whatsmyip.org

I will add a tut on how to get no-ip if people ask-- Thanks.

that was my guide until it got locked…:’(-- that should make it work if your confused about your router ask…:)[/quote]

You sir know nothing about networking. Nice job blocking your internal address but leaving your WAN address wide open to the public. 192.168 addresses are only accessible behind the router, and btw nice filtering, your LAN ip is 192.168.2.5.

Read full topic

item.title: Why is my server still offline!? when I run it!? someone help!
item.dc:creator: @wrath0fgufix wrath0fgufix
item.description:
@wrath0fgufix wrote:

It is because of one of these: your not running it right (you didn’t chasnge the ip to your own)

you did not portforward correctly

Uhm if you need to know how to portforward here is a guide I made.

Hello, i am showing how to portforward on your router.

First you’ll need to find your gateway ip address. Open your start menu and push the tab “run”

Then a small box will pop up–type in “Cmd” like the following

Then a new box will pop up that looks like this:

From here you will type in “ipconfig”

Then it will pop up a different things, you’ll want to find a “default gateway”
Next you will open your internet, and as your url you will type the “default gateway in the url.” Something sorta like this will be shown:

3590qya.jpg383×800

Then you will find something like virtual servers, it will ask you for a password leave it blank or use “admin”
It will then bring you to a different page that will look somewhat like this (matters what router you have)

It should be on the blank part where my “.5” it will be your ip address not your default gateway: look in your cmd for it

It should look like that or maybe w/o UDP
Then you can either use no-ip.org or www.whatsmyip.org

I will add a tut on how to get no-ip if people ask-- Thanks.

that was my guide until it got locked…:’(-- that should make it work if your confused about your router ask…

Read full topic
